author: terence0083
content: EIP4844 uses **versioned hash**: 0x01 (representing the version) followed by the last 31 bytes of the SHA256 hash of the KZG. This is for EVM and future compatibility (eg. for quantum-resistance reasons). Can we reserve 0xFF for chain-specific hash types. Example that would let L2s innovate without the danger of collision. Is there a place to spec this out?
